name: Golden Gazpacho Dip
author: SandyG
summary: Look for the yellowest tomatoes and the brightest yellow squash for this soup-inspired dip. As the dip rests, it may give off liquid, which can be drained if you like.
ingredients: 1  yellow bell pepper, quartered, seeded, cut into large pieces
1  yellow squash, halved lengthwise and cut into large pieces
1 tablespoon cider vinegar or white balsamic vinegar
directions: Core tomatoes and cut a shallow X in bottom of each with a knife
Fill a bowl with ice and cold water
Blanch tomatoes in a large pot of boiling water for 10 seconds
Remove with a slotted spoon and immediately transfer to ice water
Squeeze tomatoes over a bowl to remove seeds
Pulse pepper, squash, vinegar, olive oil, and salt in food processor 2 or 3 times, until very coarse
Cut tomatoes into large chunks, add to food processor along with dill, and pulse several times until combined but still slightly chunky
Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve
